intro: Zexmenia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and small, aromatic leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Zexmenia fasciculata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
